args: What is it, Lady Yukimura? Did you\nperhaps eat something bad?
No, Izumo, I did not! General Shingen left\nme in charge of things, and I'm just\nin awe again of how great he is.
The general isn't just strong—he has\nhigh support from his citizens, and each\nof his vassals are great warriors!
So that's what you were oohing and aahing\nabout. I agree that Lord Shingen's virtues\nare both many and impressive.
There have been rumors in court that he\nmight even be the most suitable to take\nup the mantle of the next shogun.
'Cause he's the greatest in all Hinomoto!\nI gotta learn more from him, Izumo.\nI JUST GOTTA!
Lord Shingen...here is your medicine and\nsome water...
You look rough, Shingen—and I hear that\nmedicine you take has major side effects.\nHow bad are things, anyway?

Don't lobby such strange charges about.
Lord Shingen is a peerless and fine
specimen, and he would never get ill
as weaker men do.

She has already seen the medicine bag,
and Mitsuhide is one of the sharpest of the
Wyrmclan leaders besides. There is little
point in attempting deception.
Thanks for the compliment. Now spill it!\nWhat's going on with you?
I have a stomach illness that the doctor\nclaims has progressed to a critical state.
You're the most senior Wyrmclan leader,\nright? Maybe this illness is an effect of\nyour soulpact.
I know naught about its causes.\nBut whatever the case, it is assured\nthat I have limited time remaining.
Only you, Fudo Myo-o, and my personal\nphysician are aware of this fact.
And I could get through this without\nunnecessary hubbub if you could simply\nact as though you never saw my bag.

Sure, but what if you tell people and one
of them knows how to help? And besides,
look at you! There's no way you'll be able
to keep this under your hat for long.
Before that happens, I will retire like\nYoshitsune of the Rooster clan and entrust\nmy territory and vassals to Yukimura.

The bigshots at the shogunate will have a
real headache on their hands if they have
to look for another family line that can
form soulpacts.
It's quality that matters, not quantity.\nThe present Wyrmclan leaders are more\nthan enough to hold Hinomoto together.
By the way, you were pretty vague when\nNobunaga asked about your ambitions\nfor being shogun. Was that for her?

With so little time left, I am unsuited for
the position. But when people have no one
to compete against, they tend to neglect
improving themselves.

Well, I suppose there aren't any big
disadvantages to keeping this thing
hidden, so it's not strictly necessary
to tell everyone...

But I'm opposed. I mean, the secret to
being lazy is having someone indebted to
you. You want to deal with this alone? 
It's against my nature to let that pass!
I mean, the Wyrmclan leaders are touchy,\nbut they're also a bunch of softies.
Including you—which is why I want to\nconceal my illness from them.
People are a castle, a stone wall, a moat,\nand a mirror.
I want to be a mirror for the other leaders\nand show my attitude to live resolutely\nand daringly until I retire.
So in the end, you just want to try\nand act cool? That's stupid.
When the end approaches, such ＂stupid＂\nthings become important. Someday you\nwill also come to understand this.
...All right. I'll keep mum about it.
But in exchange, you're going to show\na way to live with such daring that it can\neven motivate a slacker like me!
I sweated quite a bit in my sumo bout,\nso another dip will be just the thing...
Doing this keenly reminds me of the last\ntime I had a drink with Yoshitsune.
You're retiring as a Wyrmclan leader?
Yes. Thanks to Tsukuyomi being gone,\nmy body has returned to the way it was.

You're a smart cookie. You must have
guessed which vassal released
Tsukuyomi's seal all those years ago—and
which lord that vassal was trying to aid.
If Wyrmclan leaders are so short-lived,\nhow was I able to lead the Rooster clan\nfor more than twenty years?

Rooster is finished. Until the next
Wyrmclan leader is found, the territory will
be returned to the shogunate, and the
vassals taken in by another.

And that's fine. That's how things would
have gone without me anyway, though it
will be a bit of an imposition on my
pactwyrm, Kurama.
What will you do after you retire?
My daughter's grave is in North Grastaea,\nso I'll tend it as best I can until my own\ncomes to claim me.
I have lost many things, but at long last\nI realize what's really important.
I don't want young people to follow in my\nfootsteps. So before I retire to private life,\nthis old soldier will do a little meddling.
There is no best way to live, but there are\nthings that may come into view as a result\nof one's time being limited.
The important thing is to become aware\nof those things quickly and take action.\nSo what's most important to you?
I was an outcast until I overthrew my\nown father and seized the clan.
Afterward, I fretted over what people\nmight think of the tiger that slew his\nown parent. But...
I have managed to make good friends,\nand this journey has been one way to\nshow a bit of piety in my own way.

The good and bad of a life is not the length
of it, and I am a lucky fellow to have such
friends and an endless stream of things to
accomplish. Isn't that right, Fudo Myo-o?
I shall be with you until the very end,\nLord Shingen.
There is no other woman as great as you.\nI am truly a lucky man.

The spread of the transient world is like the boughs
of a tree—utterly without end. This, then, was but
a possible small tale that might have taken place
after the prevention of the Tsukuyomi disaster.
